2.1.6. Lab – Implement Rate Limiting¶

The API Protection profile allows a BIG-IP administrator to throttle the amount of connections to an API through the use of Key Names.

2.1.6.1. Task – Update the pre-built Key Names¶

  1. From the Jumpbox, access the BIG-IP GUI https://10.1.1.4 (you can double-click on the BIG-IP1 bookmark from Chrome).

#. Login into the BIG-IP Configuration Utility with the following credentials: - User: admin - Password: admin

  1. Click on the Access tab located on the left side.

  1. Navigate to API Protection >> Profile. Click Profile to modify the previously created API protection Profile. Not the + Plus symbol.

  1. Click API-Protection

  1. Click Rate Limiting from the top ribbon

Note

The API protection profile default settings contains five Key Names created, but their values are empty. Additional Keys can be created if necessary

  1. Click api-protection_auto_rate_limiting_key1

  1. Enter the Key Value %{subsession.oauth.scope./Common/as-jwt-provider.jwt.user}
  2. Click Edit

  1. Click api-protection_auto_rate_limiting_key2

  1. Enter the Key Value %{subsession.oauth.scope./Common/as-jwt-provider.jwt.groupid}
  2. Click Edit

  1. Click api-protection_auto_rate_limiting_key3

  1. Enter the Key Value %{subsession.oauth.scope./Common/as-jwt-provider.jwt.client}
  2. Click Edit

  1. Click api-protection_auto_rate_limiting_key4

  1. Enter the Key Value %{subsession.oauth.scope./Common/as-jwt-provider.jwt.tier}
  2. Click Edit

  1. Click api-protection_auto_rate_limiting_key5

  1. Enter the Key Value %{subsession.oauth.scope./Common/as-jwt-provider.jwt.org}
  2. Click Edit

  1. Click Save

2.1.6.2. Task – Create a Rate Limiting Policy¶

  1. Click Create in the rate limiting section

  1. Enter the Name acme-rate-limits
  2. Move all five keys under Selected Kyes
  3. Enter 10 for the number of requests per minutes
  4. Enter 5 for the number requests per seconds
  5. Click Add.

  1. Click Save
